Subdivision.SubDescription: Hill Country Classics Custom Homes has a large selection of Texas home floor plans with footprints from 600 to 2,500 square feet. If you have ideas or plans of your own, our staff designer specializes in creating custom homes in the Texas Hill Country and can help you put your ideas on paper. HCC will work to make your ideas function with the most efficient use of space to create a unique living space for you.

Plan.Description: This efficient "Texas sized" single story design has all of the design components a Hill Country homeowner could wish for...a private master suite, formal dining room, large kitchen/breakfast area and a private study for the "bread-winner" in the house. The covered stoop just off of the laundry room would make a great place to shuck a pair of dirty boots after a long day in the pasture.

This home is designed for those needing a weekend retreat or a "get away" in the hills. Features such as the adjoining kitchen/ dining/ and living room with a spacious covered front porch really take you back to the "good old days"

This well proportioned three bedroom, two and one-half bath home provides all of the amenities for cozy Hill Country living. The quaint sitting porch just off of the master suite would be perfect for a private cup of coffee on a cool Hill Country morning.

The "dog trot" concept in this popular design has been around since the early pioneers first settled the Hill Country. Before the days of air conditioning, cross ventilation was a primary concern when designing new homes. These days, it's ideal for the "empty nesters" who have occasional guests or perhaps children who can't seem to leave home. Separate air conditioning and heating units will really cut down on utility bills.

The corner fireplace in this home steals the show! Three large bedrooms with a study and an over-sized laundry center make this the ideal home for large families or those "on the grow". The master bath features a large walk-in closet, dressing area and an "L" shaped vanity.

Views, views and more views. The 180-degree panoramic view from the wide-open kitchen, living and dining areas is complimented by a soaring cathedral ceiling spanning the entire area. The large covered porches both front and rear provide a choice of entertaining areas in either direction. This popular master bath design can be incorporated into many of our other homes as well.

This two bedroom, two bath "T" shaped design is perfect for a weekend getaway or retirement home. Named for one of Texas' most famous heroes, Colonel Travis, Commander of the Alamo, this home features a "great room" effect which combines the kitchen, dining room, and living room into one huge room under a soaring cathedral ceiling. Inside, the fireplace is the star of the show. Outside, two super porches on either side, one for morning coffee... the other for late afternoon tea.

The wrap-around porches, island kitchen, large laundry room and cross ventilation highlight this Hill Country Classic. There's a big 180-degree view from just about anywhere in this open living, dining and kitchen area. The large utility room with its adjoining half bath provides generous space for laundry chores.

Those "cool" country breezes will find you wherever you are in this open plan. It's designed for those who like to "open up" the windows. The large breakfast bar and serving area will make food serving a "breeze".

Three bedrooms, two full baths, a huge open living, dining and kitchen area - all in 1425 square feet. The dining room with its large bay window sets the stage for some awesome early morning or late afternoon Hill Country wildlife viewing. The simple yet stylish exterior would blend into any Hill Country setting.

This efficient floor plan will let you get away from it all if you wish. It is a split bedroom arrangement which provides privacy for Mom and Dad to relax in one end of the house while the kids do their "thing" in the other. The common kitchen, living and dining room area is great for entertaining and large family gatherings.

Large closets, plenty of storage and a wide open living area make this home a "winner" in everyone's book. The rear covered porch with access to the large laundry room makes a great secondary entrance.

"Traditional Hill Country" best describes this popular single story favorite. The kitchen, with its "L" shaped counter, relates well to the living room accented by plenty of windows and a beamed cathedral ceiling. The large laundry center and four bedrooms with lots of closet space are other popular features.

The main feature of this popular design is its efficiency. Gorgeous room sizes and minimum hall space make it a big favorite. It is also only 34 feet deep and is ideal for homesites with steep front to back slopes.

This two bedroom affordable and efficient plan has long been a favorite with our customers. The bathroom is accessible from each bedroom and the living area as well. The island kitchen relates well to the living and dining areas and is ideal for those who enjoy entertaining in the kitchen.

A variation of our ever-popular Fredericksburg I floorplan is the Fredericksburg II. The large private master suite with its own full-length covered porch is great for Mom and Dad, while two large bedrooms up front relate well to the study/bedroom just off of the living room.

The slope of the roof and the full-length front porch on this home just say "Hill Country". The adjoining "king-sized" kitchen, utility and pantry really centralize work chores. Each of the upstairs bedrooms is big enough for teenagers and features a TV room or study in between.

If you are looking for traditional style all on one level, this might be the plan for you. The somewhat formal entry area leading into the centrally located living room sets the tone for what is truly an efficient design. The raised breakfast bar would easily accommodate several youngsters and really simplifies food serving. The master bedroom, living area and dining room all enjoy the same views toward the rear of this single story favorite.

One of the secrets to a successful design is being able to build the home in a variety of locations. This home is only 39 feet wide and is one of our most popular two bedroom, two bath models. It has a "big house" sized living room and kitchen, two large bedrooms and will fit most small building sites.

"A little bit of this and a little bit of that" might best describe this two bedroom, two bath favorite. Features such as dormer windows, high ceilings, a loft, french doors, a steep roof and a spacious screened porch make this home a true Hill Country Classic. Either "swingin" on the front porch or "snoozin" on the back porch, you can't help but find comfort in this original HCC design.ustom designs and revisions to our existing plans we have built over the years.

Screened porches have always been a Texas favorite. This two bedroom, two bath home is just right for a weekend retreat or a retirement home in the hills and features a screened sleeping porch. This narrow floor plan is ideal for narrow riverfront building sites.

This home is named for one of the state's legends who built the Y.O. Ranch near Kerrville. Downstairs, the master suite provides king-sized accommodations for Mom and Dad while the three bedrooms upstairs will easily handle several house guests or budding teenagers. Outside, large porches at the front and side of the home set a friendly Texas tone that literally says, "Welcome, stranger".

If you've got a "thing" for wasted space, this is the home for you. There's not a single hallway in this efficient plan. The huge kitchen and dining area allow plenty of "elbow room" for the cook. The "L" shaped kitchen/dining/living area is great for entertaining.

"The Hondo" would satisfy almost any Texan's appetite for large rooms and generous spaces. The bay window brightens the breakfast area and kitchen while relating well to the large living room with a loft above. The private "executive size" master bedroom and bath would be a great place to relax after a "hard day's work".

Take your pick... a two bedroom, two bath single story or a four bedroom, three bath two story. This home may be built either way by simply omitting the second floor or leaving it just as it is. Whichever you choose, large rooms and plenty of porches will surely make this home a Hill Country favorite.
Cooks take note! You won't be left out of the action in this popular plan. Big rooms, a home office and an executive sized master suite make this home a true Hill Country favorite.

The cathedral ceiling in the living room in this home is over 20 feet high! The second floor loft looks down into the living room and could serve as a 4th bedroom, home office or den. This home would look great on any Hill Country hilltop!

The balcony/loft overlooking the living room with raised cathedral ceiling would satisfy almost any Texan's appetite for wide-open spaces. The master suite includes a spacious walk-in closet and its own private covered porch. Many of the features in this home are usually reserved for those plans with much more square footage.

Large shaded porches, both front and back, compliment the massive 24' x 24' centrally located living room with adjoining kitchen and dining area in this popular design. The large walk-in closets and a huge master bath with separate bathtub and shower highlight the master bedroom in this plan. The island kitchen puts each food preparation within arms length of the cook.

Small, but efficient, this plan offers many of the same design elements as our larger homes. Totally self-sufficient, it would make a great weekend retreat, guest house or perhaps independent living quarters for an "ornery" mother-in-law.
